morning_message1.message: Good Morning, [caregiver name]. If at any time you feel that you or [care recipient name] are unsafe or need help, please follow your emergency plan.

morning_reflection1.message: What has been rewarding about your caregiving?

morning_reflection2.message: What do you most look forward to/enjoy/value about taking care of your loved one?

morning_reflection3.message: What are some good memories of your loved one that you can draw on to keep you going?

morning_reflection4.message: What kind of meaning do you find in caregiving?

positive_general1.message: [MM] You're providing a familiar/secure/routine/pleasant environment for [care recipient name].

positive_general2.message: [MM] You know [care recipient name] best and will be able to identify subtle differences in their well-being.

positive_general3.message: [MM] You know [care recipient name] best and can create meaningful and engaging activities that are best suited for him/her personally.

positive_general4.message: [MM] Look at your card to send your intention for today

positive_general5.message: [MM] Think about what's important to you today. Look at the card if it would help.

positive_general6.message: [MM] Caring for [care recipient name] is allowing you to spend quality/important time with [care recipient name].

positive_general7.message: [MM] Your providing a familiar environment for your loved one during a difficult time.

positive_general8.message: [MM] Take a moment now to reflect on the following question: [MRM]

positive_accomp1.message: [MM] You have developed many useful and creative skills by caring for your loved one.

positive_accomp2.message: [MM] Caring for your loved one can help improve their well-being.

positive_feeling1.message: [MM] As their caregiver, you are providing an important companionship for your loved one.

positive_feeling2.message: [MM] Caregiving has allowed you to return the love and care you have received from [care recipient name] over the years.

positive_feeling3.message: [MM] Your care has allowed [care recipient name]'s to preserve a sense of self-identity.

positive_feeling4.message: [MM] You're following through on the promises you made in your wedding vows.

positive_family1.message: [MM] You are an excellent role-model for your [kids/grandkids/children/grandchildren].

positive_family2.message: [MM] Your [kids/children] appreciate the care you provide for [care recipient name].

positive_family3.message: [MM] You are setting a fantastic example of how to love and care for family.

positive_growth1.message: [MM] Even though this has been challenging, you have been so strong.

positive_growth2.message: [MM] You have overcome so much through this, and you're still going!

positive_growth3.message: [MM] Through caregiving you have strengthened your patience and ability to care for others' needs.

positive_growth4.message: [MM] You have strengthened your ability to juggle many things at once by caring for [care recipient name].

encouragement_general1.message: You did a great job keeping yourself calm yesterday. [B]

encouragement_general2.message: Self-care means learning how to give the best version of yourself to the people who depend on you. [B]

encouragement_general3.message: Stress tries to stop you from giving your best to your loved ones - and you are learning to reduce its influence on you. [B]

encouragement_general4.message: [B] Great job keeping your emotions under control yesterday.

encouragement_general5.message: Your effort is making a bigger difference than you think. [B]

encouragement_general6.message: Brief moments of self-care are increasing the quality of the care you give. [B]

encouragement_general7.message: It's hard to care for others when you haven't cared for yourself, and you did a good job caring for yourself yesterday.

encouragement_general8.message: [B] It takes extra effort to care for yourself, but this work is making a difference for you and your loved one.

encouragement_success1.message: [A] made a big difference for you yesterday. [B]

encouragement_success2.message: [A] is hard work, but you're learning how to use it when you need it.

encouragement_unsuccess1.message: It takes a long time to master [A] [C]

encouragement_unsuccess2.message: Looks like it was difficult to implement [A] [C]

encouragement_extreme1.message: It looks like it was a tough day. And, you were successful in doing [A] [C]

encouragement_extreme2.message: Notice what's working, [A], and do that more.

self_care_goal1.message: Remember that while you are providing care for a loved one, you also need take care of yourself. Try to take some time now to set a self-care goal for today.

self_care_goal2.message: Now would be a good time to create a self-care goal for today.

self_care_goal3.message: Take a moment to set your daily intention to care for yourself in some way.

check_in1.message: Can you identify any unmet needs that could be contributing to [care recipient name]'s restlessness? Addressing those needs may help calm him/her down.

check_in2.message: It seems like you and [care recipient name] may be experiencing a stressful situation. Address any safety concerns now.

check_in3.message: It seems like you and [care recipient name] may be experiencing a stressful situation. Take a moment to scan your current environment for distractions. For example, [distractions]

check_in4.message: Take a moment to modify your surroundings to reduce [care recipient name]'s restlessness?

check_in5.message: Do a scan of the environment. Are there any stressors that may be escalating your situation? If so, attempt to limit or remove those stressors.

recomm_timeout1.message: Now might be a good time to take a brief break.

recomm_timeout2.message: Take a quick moment for yourself.

recomm_timeout3.message: Take some time to "put on your oxygen mask."

recomm_timeout5.message: It seems like this could be a good time to take a time-out.

recomm_timeout6.message: Feel free to step away if you need to collect your thoughts.

recomm_timeout7.message: Feel free to step away if you need to settle yourself.

recomm_timeout8.message: It seems like you could use some uninterrupted personal time, can you engage your loved one in an activity that they enjoy?

recomm_timeout9.message: Engage [care recipient name] in an engaging activity and give yourself a few moments of personal time?

recomm_breathing4.message: Breathe in through your nose and out through your mouth.

recomm_breathing8.message: Try some breathing exercises on your calm app.

recomm_mindful2.message: Perform a body scan using your calm app.

recomm_meaningful1.message: You know [care recipient name] best, what's an activity that he/she has always enjoyed?-included in caregiver training.

recomm_meaningful2.message: Are you able to set up an activity for your loved one now?

recomm_meaningful3.message: Now might be a good time to start an activity with/for your loved one.

recomm_meaningful4.message: You and your loved one may benefit from engaging in an activity that you both enjoy.

recomm_meaningful5.message: Now might be a good time to do something you and [care recipient name] love doing together.

recomm_meaningful6.message: Can you start an activity with/for [care recipient name] that would make you both feel calmer?

recomm_meaningful7.message: Trying engaging [care recipient name] in an activity or task that provides them with a sense of ease.

postrecomm_implement.message: Did you do the stress management tip we sent?

postrecomm_helpfulyes.message: On a scale from 1-10 how helpful was the stress management tip?

postrecomm_helpfulno.message:
What prevented you from doing the stress management tip?[]1 I didn't have time
2 I didn't think it would help
3 I didn't see the message

likert_stress1.message: On a scale from 1-10, how stressful was your day today?

likert_lonely1.message: Today, on a scale from 1-10, how lonely did you feel?

likert_health1.message: On a scale from 1-10, how would you say your physical health is today?

likert_health2.message: On a scale from 1-10, how would you say your emotional health is today?

daily_goal1.message: Did you meet your self-care goal for today?

daily_goalno1.message:
What made it difficult for you to complete your goal?[]1 I didn't have enough time
2 I was too tired or stressed
3 I was distracted by other tasks or activities
4 I did not set a goal

stress_manag1.message: Did you do a stress management tip today?

stress_managyes1.message:
Which stress management tip or tips did you do today?[]1 Deep breathing
2 Time out
3 Mindfulness
4 Meaningful Activity

stress_managyes2.message: On a scale from 0-10, how helpful was the stress management tip?

stress_managno1.message:
What prevented you from doing the stress management tip(s)?[]1 I didn't have time.
2 I didn't think it would help.
3 I didn't see the message(s).

system_helpful1.message: On a scale from 1-10, how helpful were today's stress management tips?

system_helpful2.message:
Which stress management tip helped most?[]1 Mindfulness
2 Time out
3 Meaningful Activity
4 Deep Breathing

system_helpful3.message:
Did any of the stress management tips help reduce your stress?[]1 Mindfulness
2 Time Out
3 Meaningful Activity
4 Deep Breathing

weekly_survey1.message:
This week, which tips have been the most helpful?[]1 Mindfulness
2 Deep Breathing
3 Meaningful activities
4 Time Out
5 Reflecting on the positive aspects of caregiving
6 Receiving encouraging words in the morning
7 Setting my morning self-care goal

weekly_messages1.message: Do you like the number of messages you receive in a day?

weekly_messagesno1.message:
Would you like:[]1 More Messages
2 Fewer Messages

weekly_msgetime1.message: Do you still like the amount of time between messages?

weekly_msgetimeno1.message:
How would you like to change the amount of time?[]1 More time between messages
2 Less time between messages

weekly_startstop1.message: Do you still like the start and stop time for the messages?

weekly_start1.message:
Please choose your preferred start time:[]1 2 hours earlier
2 1.5 hours earlier
3 1 hour earlier
4 30 minutes ealier
5 No Change
6 30 minutes later
7 1 hour later
8 1.5 hours later
9 2 hours later

weekly_stop1.message:
Please choose your preferred start time:[]1 2 hours earlier
2 1.5 hours earlier
3 1 hour earlier
4 30 minutes ealier
5 No Change
6 30 minutes later
7 1 hour later
8 1.5 hours later
9 2 hours later
